Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: A specific type of dagger with a short $(this.trait:material) curved blade and a medial ridge. A significant part of the weapon is its $(this.trait:horn) hilt which is often constructed from various horns 'donated' by slaves. The design and detail of the handle is a measure of its value, and the status of its owner. The double-sided blade is always constructed from a variation of steel and stored in a sheath usually made of wood covered with metal or cloth. Although used occasionally in times of dispute, the societal acceptance of this weapon is centered around it only coming out of its sheath in extreme cases of violence. Like with other curved knives, as the blade bends toward the opponent, the used doesn't need to bend the wrist which makes it more comfortable as a stabbing weapon than straight-bladed knives. Its heavy blade enables the wielder to inflict deep wounds and to effortlessly cut through muscles and bone. It has a $(this.trait:horn) hilt. The lower portion of the dagger that allows the wielder to handle the weapon. A leather piece is wrapped around it for a more comfortable grip.
